intro: Plagiobothrys gracilis, commonly known as the slenderleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland and scrub habitats. It has small, ovate leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. Plagiobothrys gracilis is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in late spring to early summer.
